result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Allen W. Motley

records.addlTxt: Calendar call on November 10, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

10:09 AM Defendant Allen W. Motley appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Robert N Forseth appeared by video for Allen W. Motley.  Attorney Jedidiah J Dodge appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Cases 20CF176, 2022CF000040, 2022CF000069, 2022CF000070, 2022CF000076, 2022CF000136, and 2022CF000256.
Court questions the parties.
Atty Forseth informs the court that there is one issue of where the sentence will be served.
Court  states it does not have any ability to determine if the defendant will be serving in prison or in jail as that is determined by the Dept. of Corrections.
ADA Dodge informs the court that the offer is the same and now the defendant doesn't want to agree.
These cases were scheduled for trial and were removed for this plea & sentencing date today.
Atty Forseth and the defendant are sent to a break out room - Judge will break for 5 mins.
10:33 AM Court back in session.  Parties inform the court they need to schedule a trial for 20CF176.
Calendar call scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

4:05 pm State appears by ADA Jedidiah Dodge.  Defendant appears in custody from the Portage County Jail with Atty Robert Forseth.
Court questions counsel about the trial set for tomorrow.
ADA Dodge makes statment; State has relayed a counter offer and is waiting for a respons.
Court adjourns for parties to be placed in a breakout room to discuss.
Adjourned 4:08 pm
Back on the record 4:11 pm
Atty Forseth advises they have a settlement agreement.
Court questions defendant.
Speedy trial demand and agreement
Defendant understands both. Atty Forseth withdraws speedy trial demand and requests plea/sentencing/
Hearing to be set..
Court set plea/sentencing for 11-01-22 at 10:00 a.m.
Court approves all appearances remotely.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 1, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Letter to Judge Moran Regarding Witnesses from ADA Dodge dated 10/17/22 (sent to Judge Moran on 10/18/22 sp)

Appearances: State of WI appears by ADA Jedidiah Dodge; Defendant appears from Waupaca County Jail with Atty Robert Forseth; All appearances via Marathon County Zoom. 
Date and time set for a motion hearing.
VRCW.

COURT notes cases are set for a speedy trial, and nothing has been filed as far a (MIL) Motion in Limine and (JI) Jury Instructions.
COURT questions which case is going to trial.
ADA Dodge makes statement re: 22CF256, also filed motion to join cases.
COURT notes there was a speedy demand recently filed in 22CF76.
ADA Dodge indicates Defendant is being held on the cash bond in 22CF256.
Parties in agreement that 22CF256 will be the case that goes to trial next week, satisfying the time limits.
Atty Forseth has no objections to the MIL filed, but objects to the joinder of the cases.
COURT has reviewed State's Motion to Join cases.
ADA Dodge recites basis for motion.
COURT addresses parties.
Atty Forseth states objections to motion, his client only wishes to proceed in 22CF256.
COURT addresses parties re: joining cases and trial being held in 1 day.
ADA Dodge indicates if joinder is not granted, he is requesting an Other Acts hearing.
COURT addresses parties.
COURT denies motion to join cases, reiterates 22CF256 will be tried separately from the rest of the cases, and notes Other Acts will need to be addressed.
Re: Other Acts:
Parties stipulate that COURT can decide that prior to trial, another hearing is not necessary. 
COURT addresses parties re: Sullivan test.
COURT requests parties to respond to Other Acts in writing, and hearing will be held prior to trial.
COURT addresses MIL;
#4 will be addressed morning of JT.
No objections. 
COURT grants MIL.
COURT instructs parties re: final offer.
Atty Forseth in agreement with JI and does not plan on filing anymore.

DATES to remain.

Adjourned: 	9:28 a.m.
State's Motion on Prior Convictions (sent to Judge Moran on 10/11/22 sp)
State's Proposed Jury Instructions. Filed by Prosecutor.
Motion Hearing set for 09/07/22 and Jury Trial - 12 Person set for 10/19/22 - UNCLAIMED
State's Jury Trial Witness List (sent to Judge Moran on 09/09/22 sp)
State's Motion to Join Portage County Case Numbers 22CF256, 22CF136, 22CF70, 22CF69, 22CF40 and 22CF176 (sent to Judge Moran on 09/08/22 sp)

11:13 AM Defendant Allen W. Motley appeared by video, in custody from Waupaca County Jail.  Attorney (Atty) Robert N Forseth appeared by video for Allen W. Motley.  Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Jedidiah J Dodge in court for State of Wisconsin. Cases 20CF176, 22CF40, 22CF69, 22CF70, 22CF76, 22CF136, and 22CF256.
Atty Forseth requests one bond cover all cases or reduction of bond in 22CF256.
ADA Dodge objections are heard and requests the bond modification motion be denied.
BY THE COURT:  Motion to modify bond is denied.
Jury trial - 12 person on October 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Motion hearing on September 7, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Motion to Modify Bond filed by Atty Robert N Forseth (sent to Judge Moran on 09/01/22 sp)
filed by Atty Robert N Forseth
Calendar call on September 1, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Telephone scheduling conference on September 1, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Atty Robert Forseth appointed

Letter from the Defendant dated 08/01/22 
(sent to Judge Moran on 08/03/22 sp)
Notice of Motion for Speedy Trial filed by the Defendant (sent to Judge Moran on 07/22/22 sp)
Notice of Motion and Motion for Discovery and Inspection filed by the Defendant
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Notice of Motion for a Speedy Trial filed by the Defendant
sent to Judge Moran on 07/15/22 sp
Calendar call on July 21, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

9:05 AM Defendant Allen W. Motley appeared by video.  Attorney Robert A. Gardner appeared by video for Allen W. Motley.  Attorney Jedidiah J Dodge appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
All files heard: 20CF176, 22CF40, 22CF69, 22CF70, 22CF76, 22CF136, 22CF256

Parties state their appearances. 
Court questions if there are victims present. 
Atty Dodge indicates there is not. 

Court questions the status of the cases.  
Atty Dodge responds.  20CF176 is set for a status conference and all other files set for arraignment. 
Defendant received copy of the informations in each of these files.  
Atty Gardner notes he has not made an appearance yet on 22CF256 enters an appearance on this matter as well today. 
Atty Gardner waives reading of the informations.  Understands the information in 22CF256 mirrors the complaint. 

Atty Gardner stands mute.
Court enters NOT GUILTY plea(s) to all the counts in each of the informations that have been filed.

Defendant makes statements to the court. 
Court addresses the defendant and asks that he allow the court to run this hearing. 

Court questions if a speedy trial is being requested. 
Atty Gardner makes statements.  He just got on board for 22CF256.  Sees that the defendant filed a pro se motion to modify the bail in that matter.  Asks to set that pro se motion as soon as possible.  He will meet with his client at the Waupaca County jail as soon as possible.  
Defendant again interrupts the court and states he wants a speedy trial. 

Court will set the matter for a bond motion with the judicial assistant.   
Court informs the defendant he will be muting him if he does not stop interrupting the court. 
Court informs the defendant to speak with his attorney.  A bond hearing will be set as soon as possible and the defendant can discuss the speedy trial demand with his attorney. 

Calendar call set for next Thursday 7/21/2022 at 1:00 p.m.  Parties are to call in to set the bond modification hearing. 
Defendant again states he wants a speedy trial. 
Atty Gardner states he will be speaking with the defendant tomorrow. 
Defendant asks to speak to the court. 
Court will allow him to do that if his attorney allows him to. 
Atty Gardner informs the defendant not to speak. 
Defendant continues to make statements. 
Court  is adjourned.
Calendar call scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Notice of Motion and Motion for Bond filed by the Defendant
sent to Judge Moran on 07/11/22 sp
Notice of Motion for Speedy Trial - pro se (sent to judge review)
Arraignment on July 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
from Defendant to Judge and DA

3:07 PM Prosecuting attorney Jedidiah J Dodge in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Allen W. Motley in court. 

Atty Dodge calls the case and states the appearances. 
Court questions the defendant regarding counsel status. 
Defendant responds.  He does qualify for counsel, they are just trying to find him an attorney.  He would like to be represented at the preliminary hearing.  Asks to address bond. 
Court questions Atty Dodge regarding how the matter was scheduled for today. 
Atty Dodge responds. 

State has complied with Victim Notification statutes. 
Victim is not present. 

Court notes this matter should not have been scheduled for a preliminary hearing.  Court will adjourn the matter for an adjourned initial appearance to allow time for the appointment of counsel.  There is no documentation from the public defender on their search.  
Court questions the defendant again. 
Defendant responds.  
Atty Dodge indicates Atty Bergner was present at the riverside hearing. 
Court reviews the minutes and the defendant indicated he would hire a private attorney. 
Defendant makes additional statements and he did qualify.  Makes bond arguments. 

BY THE COURT:  Court will proceed with the preliminary hearing today with the understanding that he can ask for another hearing when he has counsel. 
3:15 p.m.  Court takes a recess to call waiver hearings at this time. 

3:58 p.m.  Court recalls the case. 
Officer C. Stankowski is called and sworn. 
Direct exam by Atty Dodge. 
Witness identifies the defendant. 
State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes.
Victim is not present. 
Direct exam continues by Atty Dodge. 

Atty Dodge asks the court to take judicial notice of the bond and conditions of no contact with the victim in 20CF176, 22CF40, 22CF69, 22CF70, 22CF136 
BY THE COURT:  Court takes judicial notice of the bonds that was set and the conditions set forth in those bonds. 
Court finds it is probable that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it and binds the defendant over for trial. 

Defendant makes statements. 
Court advises the defendant that the statements he makes may be used against him and if he had counsel they would tell him not to speak. 
Defendant understands but continues to make statements. 
Atty Dodge states the bond motion was heard on June 13th.  Objects to bond modification.  
Court does see the letter requesting the bond modification.  Informs the defendant he will need to file a new request in writing. 
Defendant questions the court. 
Court responds.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on August 29, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Notice of Assignment of Judge - Return to sender Not deliverable as addressed
Preliminary Hearing set for 07/05/22 - insufficient address
Notice of Assignment of Judge - Return to sender Vacant
Judge Michael Moran assigned
Preliminary Hearing and Arraignment set for 06/20/22 mailed to Fond Du Lac County Jail - not deliverable as addressed/not in custody
/s/LJM 6/22/2022 - Approved.

records.addlTxt:
Filed by the  State:  Prelim set for 07/05/22 in Br 2 @ 3 
REASON FOR ADJOURNMENT: Officer out on vacation
Preliminary hearing on July 5, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant request bond be modified.
ADA Cassidy states there is a letter in the file from the Defendant requesting bond reduction.
Court reads the letter request.
Defendant makes statements in support of modifying his bond.
ADA Cassidy's objections to modifying the bond are heard by the court.
BY THE COURT:  Bond continued. 

Defendant requests a Speedy Trial

1:59 PM Prosecuting attorney Kelly A Cassidy in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Allen W. Motley appeared by video, in custody. 
Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Court advises defendant of right to counsel/public defender representation.
Defendant wishes to proceed forward today and states he has Atty Robert Gardner representing him.
State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes.
Victim is not present.
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment scheduled for June 20, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment on June 20, 2022 at 03:00 pm. (mailed to Fond du Lac County Jail also)

Letter from the Defendant dated 06/09/22 in re:  request for bond modification
sent to Br 2 JA on 06/10/22 sp

No contact with S.R. or be within 1/2 mile of residence.
Follow all other bonds he is under
Not commit any new offenses.

Court ordered quashed following hearing
(faxed to dispatch successful)

Defendant Allen W. Motley appeared by video, in custody. Atty Maxwell Bergner for defendant Allen W. Motley. Attorney Kelly Cassidy in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court calls case.
Atty Cassidy states the appearances. 
Atty Cassidy makes statements to the Court. 
Court finds probable cause that crimes have been committed and that this defendant committed them.
.
Court questions Atty Bergner as to whether would like to proceed with initial appearance. 
Atty Bergner requests an adjourned initial appearance as defendant will be retaining a private attorney.
Court questions defendant. 
Defendant makes statements. 
Court reminds defendant of his right to remain silent.
Atty Bergner requests that defendant remain silent.
Defendant states would like to plead guilty for the reasons stated.
Court responds to statements of the defendant. 

State requests a $500 cash bond with conditions as stated. 
Atty Bergner objects to cash bond for reasons stated and requests signature bond.  
Court notes defendant continues to make statements and is walking away. 

(Court notes off the record that warrant is quashed. )
Initial appearance scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Criminal Warrant filed by the State (sent to Br 3 Judge on 05/31/22 sp)
